findings.title: Weak Gateway Token
findings.description: Gateway token 'test-token-123' is weak and easily guessable. Length is only 15 characters and contains dictionary words.
findings.impact: Complete system compromise. Attacker gains unauthorized access to all sessions, can execute commands, read conversation history, and control the entire OpenClaw instance.
findings.attack_scenario: Attacker discovers gateway port via scanning, attempts common tokens, gains full access.
findings.remediation: Generate strong 64-character random token using: openssl rand -hex 32

findings.title: Public Gateway Exposure
findings.description: Gateway bound to 0.0.0.0 (all interfaces), exposing it to the internet. Should use localhost (127.0.0.1) unless explicitly required.
findings.impact: Increases attack surface. Combined with weak token, enables remote exploitation.
findings.attack_scenario: Port scanner discovers open gateway, brute force attack on authentication.
findings.remediation: Change bind to '127.0.0.1' unless remote access explicitly needed. If needed, use firewall rules and strong authentication.

findings.title: Unrestricted Command Execution
findings.description: Exec tool configured with 'allow-all' policy, permitting arbitrary command execution without restrictions.
findings.impact: If gateway is compromised, attacker can execute any system command. Enables data exfiltration, system takeover, and lateral movement.
findings.attack_scenario: After gateway compromise, attacker uses exec tool to run malicious commands (data theft, backdoor installation).
findings.remediation: Switch to 'allowlist' policy with only required commands. Example: ['ls', 'cat', 'grep']

findings.title: Missing Telegram Chat Whitelist
findings.description: Telegram bot configured without allowed_chats restriction. Bot will respond to any chat, enabling unauthorized access.
findings.impact: Anyone discovering the bot can interact with your OpenClaw instance, potentially triggering sensitive operations.
findings.attack_scenario: Attacker discovers bot username, sends commands, gains access to agent functionality.
findings.remediation: Add allowed_chats array with specific chat IDs. Example: allowed_chats: [123456789, 987654321]
